data.title: Roman Sorting
data.statement:
Sort a list of integer values in alphabetical order of their standard-form Roman numeral representations.
{{I}}=1, {{V}}=5, {{X}}=10, {{L}}=50, {{C}}=100, {{D}}=500, {{M}}=1000 
{{IV}}=4, {{IX}}=9, {{XL}}=40, {{XC}}=90, {{CD}}=400, {{CM}}=900

Note that:
49 = {{XLIX}}, not {{IL}}
999 = {{CMXCIX}}, not {{IM}}

<<EXAMPLE>>
`3
44
63
97`
44 = XLIV, alphabetically 3rd
63 = LXIII, alphabetically 1st
97 = XCVII, alphabetically 2nd

Output: 
`63 97 44`
For more on standard-form Roman numerals, see `https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_numerals#Standard_form`
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read x:int
write 50 60 40
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]], the number of integers to be sorted
<<Next [[n]] lines>>: a positive integer [[x]]
data.outputDescription: The [[n]] integers from the input, space-separated and arranged in alphabetical order of the Roman-numeral representation of each [[x]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Sort a list of integer values in alphabetical order of their standard-form Roman numeral representations.
I=1, V=5, X=10, L=50, C=100, D=500, M=1000
IV=4, IX=9, XL=40, XC=90, CD=400, CM=900

Note that:
49 = XLIX, not IL
999 = CMXCIX, not IM

EXAMPLE
3
44
63
97

44 = XLIV, alphabetically 3rd
63 = LXIII, alphabetically 1st
97 = XCVII, alphabetically 2nd

Output: 
63 97 44

For more on standard-form Roman numerals, see 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_numerals#Standard_form
Input
Line 1: An integer n, the number of integers to be sorted
Next n lines: a positive integer x
Output
The n integers from the input, space-separated and arranged in alphabetical order of the Roman-numeral representation of each x
Constraints
1 <= n <= 20
1 <= x <= 3999
Example
Input
7
1
5
10
50
100
500
1000
Output
100 500 1 50 1000 5 10
